<!-- ======== START OF CLASS DATA ======== -->
<H2>
<FONT SIZE="-1">
coreservlets</FONT>
<BR>
Class  ServletUtilities</H2>
<PRE>
<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html">java.lang.Object</A>
  |
  +--<B>coreservlets.ServletUtilities</B>
</PRE>
<HR>
<DL>
<DT>public class <B>ServletUtilities</B><DT>extends <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html">Object</A></DL>

<P>
Some simple time savers. Note that most are static methods.
  <P>
  Taken from Core Servlets and JavaServer Pages
  from Prentice Hall and Sun Microsystems Press,
  http://www.coreservlets.com/.
  &copy; 2000 Marty Hall; may be freely used or adapted.
<P>
<HR>

<P>
<!-- ======== INNER CLASS SUMMARY ======== -->

<!-- ========== METHOD SUMMARY =========== -->

<A NAME="method_summary"><!-- --></A>
<TABLE BORDER="1" CELLPADDING="3" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCCCFF" CLASS="TableHeadingColor">
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE="+2">
<B>Method Summary</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="white" CLASS="TableRowColor">
<TD ALIGN="right" VALIGN="top" WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="-1">
<CODE>static&nbsp;<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A></CODE></FONT></TD>
<TD><CODE><B><A HREF="../coreservlets/ServletUtilities.html#filter(java.lang.String)">filter</A></B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;input)</CODE>

<BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Given a string, this method replaces all occurrences of
  '<' with '&lt;', all occurrences of '>' with
  '&gt;', and (to handle cases that occur inside attribute
  values), all occurrences of double quotes with
  '&quot;' and all occurrences of '&' with '&amp;'.</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="white" CLASS="TableRowColor">
<TD ALIGN="right" VALIGN="top" WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="-1">
<CODE>static&nbsp;<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/Cookie.html">Cookie</A></CODE></FONT></TD>
<TD><CODE><B><A HREF="../coreservlets/ServletUtilities.html#getCookie(javax.servlet.http.Cookie[], java.lang.String)">getCookie</A></B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/Cookie.html">Cookie</A>[]&nbsp;cookies,
          <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;cookieName)</CODE>

<BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Given an array of cookies and a name, this method tries
  to find and return the cookie from the array that has
  the given name.</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="white" CLASS="TableRowColor">
<TD ALIGN="right" VALIGN="top" WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="-1">
<CODE>static&nbsp;<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A></CODE></FONT></TD>
<TD><CODE><B><A HREF="../coreservlets/ServletUtilities.html#getCookieValue(javax.servlet.http.Cookie[], java.lang.String, java.lang.String)">getCookieValue</A></B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/Cookie.html">Cookie</A>[]&nbsp;cookies,
               <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;cookieName,
               <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;defaultValue)</CODE>

<BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Given an array of Cookies, a name, and a default value,
  this method tries to find the value of the cookie with
  the given name.</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="white" CLASS="TableRowColor">
<TD ALIGN="right" VALIGN="top" WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="-1">
<CODE>static&nbsp;int</CODE></FONT></TD>
<TD><CODE><B><A HREF="../coreservlets/ServletUtilities.html#getIntParameter(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, java.lang.String, int)">getIntParameter</A></B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest.html">HttpServletRequest</A>&nbsp;request,
                <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;paramName,
                int&nbsp;defaultValue)</CODE>

<BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Read a parameter with the specified name, convert it
  to an int, and return it.</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="white" CLASS="TableRowColor">
<TD ALIGN="right" VALIGN="top" WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="-1">
<CODE>static&nbsp;<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A></CODE></FONT></TD>
<TD><CODE><B><A HREF="../coreservlets/ServletUtilities.html#headWithTitle(java.lang.String)">headWithTitle</A></B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;title)</CODE>

<BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<!-- ============ METHOD DETAIL ========== -->

<A NAME="method_detail"><!-- --></A>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCCCFF" CLASS="TableHeadingColor">
<TD COLSPAN=1><FONT SIZE="+2">
<B>Method Detail</B></FONT></TD>

<A NAME="headWithTitle(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3>
headWithTitle</H3>
<PRE>
public static <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A> <B>headWithTitle</B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;title)</PRE>
<DL>
</DL>
<HR>

<A NAME="getIntParameter(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, java.lang.String, int)"><!-- --></A><H3>
getIntParameter</H3>
<PRE>
public static int <B>getIntParameter</B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest.html">HttpServletRequest</A>&nbsp;request,
                                  <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;paramName,
                                  int&nbsp;defaultValue)</PRE>
<DL>
<DD>Read a parameter with the specified name, convert it
  to an int, and return it. Return the designated default
  value if the parameter doesn't exist or if it is an
  illegal integer format.</DL>
<HR>

<A NAME="getCookieValue(javax.servlet.http.Cookie[], java.lang.String, java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3>
getCookieValue</H3>
<PRE>
public static <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A> <B>getCookieValue</B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/Cookie.html">Cookie</A>[]&nbsp;cookies,
                                    <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;cookieName,
                                    <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;defaultValue)</PRE>
<DL>
<DD>Given an array of Cookies, a name, and a default value,
  this method tries to find the value of the cookie with
  the given name. If there is no cookie matching the name
  in the array, then the default value is returned instead.</DL>
<HR>

<A NAME="getCookie(javax.servlet.http.Cookie[], java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3>
getCookie</H3>
<PRE>
public static <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/Cookie.html">Cookie</A> <B>getCookie</B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/Cookie.html">Cookie</A>[]&nbsp;cookies,
                               <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;cookieName)</PRE>
<DL>
<DD>Given an array of cookies and a name, this method tries
  to find and return the cookie from the array that has
  the given name. If there is no cookie matching the name
  in the array, null is returned.</DL>
<HR>

<A NAME="filter(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3>
filter</H3>
<PRE>
public static <A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A> <B>filter</B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html">String</A>&nbsp;input)</PRE>
<DL>
<DD>Given a string, this method replaces all occurrences of
  '<' with '&lt;', all occurrences of '>' with
  '&gt;', and (to handle cases that occur inside attribute
  values), all occurrences of double quotes with
  '&quot;' and all occurrences of '&' with '&amp;'.
  Without such filtering, an arbitrary string
  could not safely be inserted in a Web page.</DL>
<!-- ========= END OF CLASS DATA ========= -->
<HR>
